drug.name: Meclocycline
drug.description: Meclocycline is under investigation in clinical trial NCT00385515 (Efficacy of SNX-1012 in the Treatment of Oral Mucositis) [L797].

article.citation: Chopra I, Roberts M: Tetracycline antibiotics: mode of action, applications, molecular biology, and epidemiology of bacterial resistance. Microbiol Mol Biol Rev. 2001 Jun;65(2):232-60 ; second page, table of contents.
Agwuh KN, MacGowan A: Pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics of the tetracyclines including glycylcyclines. J Antimicrob Chemother. 2006 Aug;58(2):256-65. Epub 2006 Jul 1.

link.title: Meclocycline Phase II Trial: Oral Mucositis

drug.indication: Currently under investigation for the topical treatment of ulcerative oral mucositis [L797]
drug.pharmacodynamics: Tetracyclines such as meclocycline are broad spectrum bacteriostatic agents [A19429]. Meclocyclin likely inhibits the growth of bacterial species present in the damaged oral mucosa, allowing the immune system to more easily eliminate infections.
drug.mechanism-of-action: As a tetracycline, meclocycline likely works by reversably associating with the 30s subint of the bacterial ribosome [A19429]. A likely binding site for tetracyclines has been identified on protein S7 of this subunit. This association blocks the association of aminoacyl-tRNA with the ribosome, inhibiting protein synthesis. Ultimately this inhibits bacterial growth due to a lack of proteins necessary for reproduction.
drug.metabolism: Most tetracyclines are not metabolized. It is unlikely that meclocycline would be metabolized [A1424].
drug.absorption: Estimated oral bioavailability of ~66% and tmax of 4h based on that of demeclocycline due to structural similarity [A1424].
drug.half-life: Half life estimated to be ~5.6h based on that of chlortetracycline due to structural similarity [A1424].
drug.protein-binding: Estimated plasma protein binding of ~75-91% based on that of demeclocycline due to structural similarity [A1424].
drug.route-of-elimination: Estimated urinary excretion of ~40% and fecal excretion of ~43% based on that of demeclocycline due to structural similarity [A1424].
drug.volume-of-distribution: Estimated Vd of 121L based on that of demeclocycline due to structural similarity [A1424].

classification.description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as tetracyclines. These are polyketides having an octahydrotetracene-2-carboxamide skeleton, substituted with many hydroxy and other groups.

affected-organisms.affected-organism: Gram negative and gram positive bacteria

drug-interaction.name: Bismuth subsalicylate
drug-interaction.description: The serum concentration of Meclocycline can be decreased when it is combined with Bismuth subsalicylate.

drug-interaction.name: Mecamylamine
drug-interaction.description: Meclocycline may increase the neuromuscular blocking activities of Mecamylamine.

drug-interaction.name: Mipomersen
drug-interaction.description: Meclocycline may increase the hepatotoxic activities of Mipomersen.

drug-interaction.name: Quinapril
drug-interaction.description: Quinapril can cause a decrease in the absorption of Meclocycline resulting in a reduced serum concentration and potentially a decrease in efficacy.

article.citation: Chopra I, Roberts M: Tetracycline antibiotics: mode of action, applications, molecular biology, and epidemiology of bacterial resistance. Microbiol Mol Biol Rev. 2001 Jun;65(2):232-60 ; second page, table of contents.

polypeptide.name: 30S ribosomal protein S7
polypeptide.specific-function: One of the primary rRNA binding proteins, it binds directly to 16S rRNA where it nucleates assembly of the head domain of the 30S subunit. Is located at the subunit interface close to the decoding center, where it has been shown to contact mRNA. Has been shown to contact tRNA in both the P and E sites; it probably blocks exit of the E site tRNA.Protein S7 is also a translational repressor protein; it regulates the expression of the str operon members to different degrees by binding to its mRNA.

article.citation: Chopra I, Roberts M: Tetracycline antibiotics: mode of action, applications, molecular biology, and epidemiology of bacterial resistance. Microbiol Mol Biol Rev. 2001 Jun;65(2):232-60 ; second page, table of contents.

Chopra I, Roberts M: Tetracycline antibiotics: mode of action, applications, molecular biology, and epidemiology of bacterial resistance. Microbiol Mol Biol Rev. 2001 Jun;65(2):232-60 ; second page, table of contents.

polypeptide.name: Outer membrane protein F
polypeptide.specific-function: Forms pores that allow passive diffusion of small molecules across the outer membrane. It is also a receptor for the bacteriophage T2.

article.citation: Chopra I, Roberts M: Tetracycline antibiotics: mode of action, applications, molecular biology, and epidemiology of bacterial resistance. Microbiol Mol Biol Rev. 2001 Jun;65(2):232-60 ; second page, table of contents.
